snippet: Scientists have been finding that the same genes that guide fetal cells as they multiply, migrate and create a newborn child are also among the primary drivers of cancer.
abstract: George Johnson Raw Data column; scientists have discovered that same genes that guide fetal cells as they multiply, migrate and create newborn child are also among primary drivers of cancer; rough similarities have been drawn between tumor growth and embryo gestation for decades, but scientists are coming to realize truth of such parallels.
lead_paragraph: Scientists have been finding that the same genes that guide fetal cells as they multiply, migrate and create a newborn child are also among the primary drivers of cancer.

headline.print_headline: A Tumor, the Embryo’s Evil Twin
headline.main: A Tumor, the Embryo’s Evil Twin
